thread.title: UP election phase 3: In litmus test, SP eyes rerun of 2012 sweep
thread.title_full: UP election phase 3: In litmus test, SP eyes rerun of 2012 sweep

title: UP election phase 3: In litmus test, SP eyes rerun of 2012 sweep
text: UP election phase 3: In litmus test, SP eyes rerun of 2012 sweep UP election phase 3: In litmus test, SP eyes rerun of 2012 sweep With the UP election juggernaut moving from the west and Rohilkhand to the central region, the battle for the state's crown has turned fiercer. The third phase on Sunday will have a significant bearing on the overall result. TNN | Updated: Feb 19, 2017, 05.43 AM IST Highlights These constituencies gave SP an unbeatable lead in 2012 The fate of the three Yadav family members - Shivpal Yadav, Mulayam's younger daughter-in-law Aparna Yadav and his nephew Anurag Yadav -will be sealed on Sunday Mulayam Singh Yadav with daughter-in-law Aparna Yadav LUCKNOW: With the UP election juggernaut moving from the west and Rohilkhand to the central region, the battle for the state's crown has turned fiercer. The third phase on Sunday will have a significant bearing on the overall result. The phase comprises the Yadav belt and state capital Lucknow, where SP nearly swept in 2012, winning 54 out of 69 seats up for grabs. This was even better than BJP's show in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls when the saffron party took lead in 52 assembly segments. Apart from the three Yadav strongholds -Etawah, Kannauj and Mainpuri, the nine other districts of Awadh going to elections include industrial hub Kanpur, Barabanki and Sitapur.Together, these constituencies gave SP an unbeatable lead in 2012. The SP family feud had initially threatened the prospects of the ruling party, but with leadership issues appearing settled, and CM Akhilesh Yadav firmly in the saddle, party supporters are in a buoyant mood. Akhilesh himself had addressed seven rallies in Etawah and Mainpuri on Thursday to assure the party's `core voters' that all was well. Both BJP and BSP, on the other hand, can hardly do worse than the last time, when they won just six seats each. BJP has fielded a large number of strong turncoats, many of them sitting MLAs of rival parties. Mayawati , after trying to consolidate Muslim votes, is back to wooing Dalits as 19 of 69 seats in this phase are reserved for SC candidates. The fate of the three Yadav family members -former minister Shivpal Yadav from Jaswantnagar, Mulayam's younger daughter-in-law Aparna Yadav in Lucknow Cantonment and his nephew Anurag Yadav in Sarojiningar-will be sealed on Sunday. While Shivpal won by more than 80,000 votes in 2012 despite visiting the constituency just once, this time he is camping there since the announcement of polls. Other big names in the fray are former BSP MP Brijesh Pathak, former UP Congress chief Rita Bahuguna Joshi -both on BJP tickets; SP ministers Arvind Singh Gope, Ravidas Mehrotra, Fareed Mehfooz Kidwai, Abhishek Mishra and Aruna Kori; BJP spokesperson H N Dikshit, BJP veteran Lalji Tandon's son Gopalji Tandon.
